titleInfo.title: CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2943, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017

name.namePart: Committee on Education and the Workforce

extension.searchTitle: CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2943, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 173

congVote.result: This NDAA includes $67.8 billion in Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding, which isn't subject to budget caps, and $8.3 billion of this funding would go to base defense budget operations. Congress and the Administration should not be able to use the account, initially used to fund the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, to pad their budgets in an era of fiscal uncertainty. The legislation also keeps intact funding for several unnecessary and outdated weapons programs and includes extraneous funding, unsolicited by the Navy, for an amphibious ship replacement program known as the LX (R).
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the conference report to accompany S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, by a yea-and-nay vote of 375 yeas to 34 nays, Roll No. 600.

congVote.result: So the conference report was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the conference report to accompany S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, by a yea-and-nay vote of 375 yeas to 34 nays, Roll No. 600.
